Content: [slack] <smk762> I was running a FR node during blast a few days ago, it was mostly responsible.

Content: [slack] <smk762> If restarting script mid blast, it spikes a bit pulling in the last 4min of data. Had some other unhandled issues with midblast restart leading to unexpected metrics, but I might have fixed that last night.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> Yes everything now uses a single docker image... for all chains, however the first 64 are a separate YAML launched on an EC2 instance so I can connect Notary Nodes hosted in Hetzner I think they are.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <patchkez:matrix.org> ok

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <patchkez:matrix.org> it is single docker image, but we still need to start 2 containers right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> Yes there is -ac and -miner in YAML but both start from same image.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <patchkez:matrix.org> blackjok3r: ok, that should not cause any issues

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> Everything is passed as ENV var, Just need to create template for your script to place all the chains in to the YAML for chains over 64.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> it works... So I imagine it should not lol.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> the next test needs to be at least 256 chains to test the stats website back end to make sure it scales linear or less than linear (?) or to see how big a server will be required for the full test.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> I think smk702 and i might need to run another 64 chain test tonight to make sure changes from last night are correct as we spent a long time squashing bugs to get everything to display correctly.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <patchkez:matrix.org> why we do not scale also stats website?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <patchkez:matrix.org> stats servers is puling the data from dynamodb right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> Its desgin should let it scale to very large numbers, but we just want check and make 100% sure... the last thing we want is to start 16000 containers and have it fail.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> Yes, the dynamoDB receives the stats from each chain, they stay there for 4 minutes, every 5s the stats site scans everything in the DB from X timestamp, then filters out anything it already has and averages the TX/s over 5s.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <blackjok3r:matrix.org> If I have understood correctly... smk702 will have better info than me though.
